name: GDPR Compliance Framework
description: General Data Protection Regulation compliance framework covering data protection principles, rights of data subjects, and organizational obligations.

framework.name: GDPR Compliance Framework
framework.description: Framework for ensuring compliance with the EU General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR)

structure.title: Chapter 2: Principles
structure.description: Principles relating to processing of personal data

items.title: Art. 5 - Principles relating to processing
items.description: Personal data shall be processed lawfully, fairly and in a transparent manner
items.summary: Core data protection principles including lawfulness, fairness, transparency, purpose limitation, data minimization, accuracy, storage limitation, integrity and confidentiality
questions: What is the lawful basis for processing?
How is transparency ensured?
Is data collection minimized to what is necessary?

items.title: Art. 6 - Lawfulness of processing
items.description: Processing shall be lawful only if at least one of the specified conditions applies
items.summary: Establish lawful basis for all processing activities
questions: Which lawful basis applies to each processing activity?
Is consent freely given, specific, informed and unambiguous?
Are legitimate interests documented and balanced?

items.title: Art. 7 - Conditions for consent
questions: Can consent be demonstrated?
Is consent request clearly distinguishable?
Can consent be easily withdrawn?

structure.title: Chapter 3: Rights of the Data Subject
structure.description: Rights of individuals regarding their personal data

items.title: Art. 12 - Transparent communication
items.description: Transparent information, communication and modalities for exercising rights
items.summary: Provide clear, accessible information about data processing
questions: Is information provided in clear and plain language?
Are requests responded to within one month?
Is information provided free of charge?

items.title: Art. 15 - Right of access
items.description: Right of access by the data subject
items.summary: Enable data subjects to access their personal data
questions: Can data subjects request access to their data?
Is a copy of data provided in electronic format?
Are all required details included in the response?

items.title: Art. 17 - Right to erasure
items.description: Right to erasure ('right to be forgotten')
items.summary: Enable deletion of personal data when requested
questions: Can data be erased upon request?
Are third parties notified of erasure?
Are exceptions properly documented?

items.title: Art. 25 - Data protection by design and default
items.description: Implement appropriate technical and organizational measures
items.summary: Build privacy into systems and processes from the start
questions: Are privacy considerations part of the design process?
Is data minimization applied by default?
Are privacy-enhancing technologies used?

items.title: Art. 30 - Records of processing activities
items.description: Maintain a record of processing activities
questions: Is a processing register maintained?
Does it include all required information?
Is it kept up to date?

items.title: Art. 32 - Security of processing
items.summary: Ensure appropriate security for personal data
questions: Is encryption used where appropriate?
Are systems regularly tested?
Is there a process for restoring data availability?

items.title: Art. 33 - Notification of personal data breach
items.description: Notify supervisory authority of breaches within 72 hours
questions: Is there a breach detection process?
Can notification be made within 72 hours?
Is there a breach register?
